subscription.description: Available only if he is an admin

field_agent_limit.description: Available only if Field Service Management feature is enbaled

field_service.description: Available only if Field Service Management feature is enabled

occasional.description: Set to true if this is an occasional agent (true => occasional, false => full-time)

signature.description: Signature of the agent in HTML format

ticket_scope.description: Ticket permission of the agent (1 -> Global Access, 2 -> Group Access, 3 -> Restricted Access). Current logged in agent can't update his/her ticket_scope

group_ids.description: Group IDs associated with the agent

role_ids.description: Role IDs associated with the agent. Atleast one role should be assoicated with the agent. Current logged in agent can't update his/her role_ids

type.description: Type of the agent ('support_agent' -> Support Agent, 'field_agent' -> Field technician)

inline_type.description: 1 - Ticket, 2 - Forum, 3 - Solution, 4 - Email notification, 5 - Template

secondary_contact_ids.description: Ids of contacts that will be merged into the Primary contact

contact.description: Values of contacts that will be merged into the Primary contact

agent_id.description: User ID of agent replying to the ticket

note_id.description: ID of note when replying to a comment

channel_id.description: ID of channel from which the reply need to be sent.

profile_unique_id.description: Receiver's unique identifier with respect to the channel, ex, phone number in WhatsApp channel.

body.description: The text of the reply message

tweet_type.description: Whether to send this as Direct Message or as a Mention

twitter_handle_id.description: Twitter Handle ID (To be fetched in a seperate API)

inline_attachment_ids.description: Represents the IDs of the attachments corresponding to inline images

ticket_ids.description: Ids of the tickets that will be merged into the Primary ticket

convert_recepients_to_cc.description: Whether to Add secondary ticket recipients to CC

custom_fields.description: Only field service appointment start and end times are permitted

user_id.description: ID of agent to be added to list of watchers

quoted_text.description: quoted text of the ticket reply

scenario_id.description: ID of scenario to be executed

local_integratable_type.description: Whether the local integratable type is ticket or timesheet

attempt.description: Sends test email if attempt is 1. Else checks for email if attempt < 5. Gives error response if attempt is >= 5.

send_to.description: Sends test email to this email ID.

subdomain.description: Domain name that needs to be validated
Domain name that needs to be updated

email.description: Admin email to convert the account to trial

drop_email.description: Email Id which has to be unblocked

enable_on_portal.description: Boolean to indicate if bot should be enabled on portal

email_channel.description: Boolean to indicate if bot should be enabled email channel

category_ids.description: Array of category ids to be mapped to the bot

article_id.description: Article to which the unanswered question must be mapped.

folder_id.description: Id of the folder under which article has to be created

trial_plan.description: name of the plan to try.

additional_cancellation_feedback.description: Additional account cancellation feedback by admin

mailbox_type.description: Possible values are freshdesk_mailbox, custom_mailbox. If set to custom_mailbox, custom_mailbox property has to be specified.

access_type.description: If access_type is both, then include both incoming and outgoing.

authentication.description: Possible values are plain, login, cram_md5

fsm_save_settings_input.description: Available only if the property has to be updated

body.description: available only when there is no s3_url

s3_url.description: available only if there is an s3_url

tags.description: Tags to be added to the email

source.description: default sources - email(1), portal(2), phone(3), forum(4), twitter(5), facebook(6), chat(7), feedback_widget(9), outbound_email(10), ecommerce(11), bot(12).

inline_attachment_ids.description: Represents the IDs of the attachments corresponding to inline images

quoted_text.description: quoted text of the ticket reply

saved_at.description: Represents the time at which the draft is saved

inline_attachment_ids.description: Represents the IDs of the attachments corresponding to inline images

visibility.description: 1 - All Agents | 2 - Agents in the group specified by group_id | 3 - Just the owner(user_id)

tickets_count.description: Number of tickets in the account

articles_count.description: Number of published articles in the portal that are visible to the bot

event.description: one of the event value [fetch_user_selected_fields, integrated_resource]

payload.description: is a json value depends on integrations.

name.description: Must be 'freshsales'. More integrations will be added later.

configs.description: This is a JSON value. The allowed attributes of this depends on the integration.

translation_summary.description: Provides status of all translations available to an article

draft_present.description: Is draft present for english translation of the article?

approval_status.description: 1 - denotes article is in review, 2 - denotes article is approved

draft_present.description: Is draft present for french translation of the article?

approval_status.description: 1 - denotes article is in review, 2 - denotes article is approved

responses_count.description: count of canned responses inside the folder

content.description: Value corresponding to the action type.

highlight.description: Shows which action has to be highlighted

report.description: file containing failed records and error messages if import is completed or killed

filter.description: filter structure for specific customers. No filters for all customers.

authentication.description: Possible values are plain, login, cram_md5.

personalized_email_replies.description: If yes, then agents will be allowed to choose their own name as the sender name in ticket replies and outbound emails. Sender email will still remain the support email address (like 'Agent Name <support@domain.freshdesk.com>').

create_requester_using_reply_to.description: If disabled, requester will be created using 'From' address in email.

allow_agent_to_initiate_converstion.description: If yes, agents will be able to send outbound emails to new or existing customers that will be converted into outbound tickets.

original_sender_as_requester_for_forward.description: When an agent forwards an email from their mailbox to the helpdesk, create the ticket under the original sender. If disabled, the requester is the agent.

allow_wildcard_ticket_create.description: If yes, users would be able to create tickets by sending emails to any variation of the support email address *@yourcompany.freshdesk.com. If no, users can create tickets by sending emails only to the support addresses which have been configured.

skip_ticket_threading.description: If yes, every reply from a requester would create a new ticket(responses would not be threaded).

threading_without_user_check.description: If yes, requester checks are not considered while threading a customer response to an existing ticket.

ends_at.description: Date on which the try higher plan feature will end

from_plan_name.description: Current plan, which the account is on, while trying higher plan

trial_plan_name.description: Name of the plan which the account is trying. Always a higher plan compared to current plan (from_plan_name).

body.description: available only when there is no s3_url

s3_url.description: available only if there is an s3_url

to_list.description: List of To emails which have failed

cc_list.description: List of Cc emails which have failed

source.description: default sources - email(1), portal(2), phone(3), forum(4), twitter(5), facebook(6), chat(7), feedback_widget(9), outbound_email(10), ecommerce(11), bot(12).

id.description: Id of the suggested article rule

description.description: A small description of the role

default.description: Flag to indicate that its a default role

privileges.description: List of Privileges associated with this role

ids.description: Array of role ID's to be updated

add.description: Contains the list of privileges to be added

remove.description: Contains the list of privileges to be removed

items.description: It is pair of date and holiday name in array

content_html.example:
Thank you for reaching out to us. Our team will look into your request and get back to you shortly.

You can check the status of your request and add comments here:
{{ticket.url}}

Regards,
{{ticket.agent.name}}

first_name.description: First name of the account's primary contact

last_name.description: Last name of the account's primary contact

phone.description: phone number of account's primary contact

in_review.description: Available only if article_approval_workflow feature enabled.

approved.description: Available only if article_approval_workflow feature enabled.

templates.description: Available only if solutions_templates feature enabled.

visible_in_portals.description: Array of portal ids to be mapped to category. Allowed only if the account is configured with multiple portals.

approver_id.description: The id of the user to whom approval is sent.

portal_id.description: Portal Id to which the category is mapped

position.description: Position of the category in that portal

category_id.description: Category id of in which this folder belongs to

company_ids.description: List of company ids for which this folder visible to. Applicable only if visibility is 4

article_order.description:
order:
  * `Custom` - 1
  * `Date Created (Newest First)` - 2
  * `Date Created (Oldest First)` - 3
  * `Last Modified (Oldest First)` - 4
  * `Title (a..z)` - 5

category_id.description: Category id of in which this folder belongs to

company_ids.description: List of company ids for which this folder visible to. Applicable only if visibility is 4

ids.description: List of folder ids to update

company_ids.description: List of company ids for which this folder visible to (Applicable only if visibility is 4).

add_to_existing.description: Indicates weather to add the list of companies to existing list or not.

ids.description: List of article ids to update

folder_id.description: New folder id of the articles

status.description:
Status value to be updated for article
  * `published` - 2

outdated.description: Status of the translation of the article

approver_id.description: User id of the agent to whom the articles were sent for approval

tags.description: Array of tags to be mapped to the articles

users.description: List of logged-in users that upvoted
List of logged-in users that upvoted

timestamp.description: Last updated timestamp of the draft. Param should not be passed when draft is not created.
Updated At timestamp of the draft

title.description: Title of the draft before autosave session started.

description.description: Description of the draft before autosave session started.

modified_at.description: Drafts's modified at value before the autosave started.

last_updated_at.description: Draft's updated at timestamp based on last autosave response(Timestamp).

user_id.description: Previous author of the draft before autosave started. This param can be skipped in case of same author.

discarded_by.description: by whom this article is discarded
by whom this article is discarded

agents_limit.title: data
agents_limit.description: Return Agent count, available seats and daypasses

email.description: Admin email of the freshcaller account

search_in_freshworks_user_info_response.title: data
search_in_freshworks_user_info_response.description: Search In Freshworks User Info Response

after_call_work.description: Needed time for agents after call

admin.description: Returns whether agent is admin or not

allow_agent_to_change_status.description: Returns whether agent is admin or not

round_robin_type.description:
Round Robin Types:
  * `0` - No auto assignment
  * `21` - Freshchat Omniroute
  * `22` - Freshchat Intelliassign
  * `26` - Freshcaller Omniroute

updated_at.description: Represents the timestamp of last successful status update in UTC.

available.description: true indicates agent is avaialble on the specific channel.

logged_in.description: true indicates agent is logged in for the given channel, Applicable for freshchat and freshcaller.

round_robin_enabled.description: true indicates agent is avaialble logged in for the given channel, Applicable for freshdesk and freshchat.

call_forward.description: true indicates calls will be forwarded to mobile, applicable for Freshcaller only

agent_availability_count_response.description: Get the count of available agents in OCR

availability.description: Agent's availability data for each channel

whitelisted_ips.description: The app can be accessed only on the IPs listed here.

applies_only_to_agents.description: This IP range checks are applicable only to agents if this is true. And applicable to everyone if this is false.

notification_emails.description: List of emails for sending notifications

minimum_characters.description: Default password_policy. Cannot be set to null

have_special_character.description: Value should be set as nil for removing this policy

atleast_an_alphabet_and_number.description: Value should be set as nil for removing this policy

password_expiry_in_days.description: Default password_policy. Cannot be set to null

have_mixed_case.description: Value should be set as nil for removing this policy

cannot_contain_user_name.description: Default password_policy. Cannot be set to null

cannot_be_same_as_past_passwords.description: Value should be set as nil for removing this policy

cannot_be_same_as_past_passwords.description: Value should be set as nil for removing this policy

credit_card_number.description: Credit card number redaction can be turned on/off

allow_iframe_embedding.description: Decides whether portal can be embedded in iframe

secure_attachments.description: Decides whether secure_attachments can be enabled or not

secure_fields.description: A setting for customers to enable using secure ticket fields

escalate_to.description: agent id to whom the ticket has to be assigned on escalation

unassigned_for.description: time period till which the ticket can remain unassigned.

contribution_agent_ids.description: agents to be provided with read access

assignment_type.description: channel specific assignment type. intelli_assign is the only option available for chat

assignment_type_settings.description: settings relevant to the selected assignment_type

escalate_to.description: agent id to whom the ticket has to be assigned on escalation

unassigned_for.description: time period till which the ticket can remain unassigned.

contribution_agent_ids.description: agents to be provided with read access

assignment_type.description: channel specific assignment type. intelli_assign is the only option available for chat

assignment_type_settings.description: settings relevant to the selected assignment_type

assignment_settings.description: sets a standard threshold value for all agents in ticket, chat and caller

assignment_preference.description: calculates priority during ticket assignment based on one of the given properties

pause_assignment_on_call.description: true indicates during call assignments will be paused

agent_individual_limits_enabled.description: true indicates individual capping limits for each agent is enabled

language.name: language
language.description: Specifies language code of the article (Multilingual feature must be enabled for the account to provide a value.if value is not given, primary language will be considered)

enforce_mandatory.name: enforce_mandatory
enforce_mandatory.description: Decides whether to perform mandatory custom field validation or not
